goals__remit:
To facilitate and promote private investment in infrastructure which enables long-term, sustainable development of communities, countries and regions. 
 
The Association’s three key priorities at the core of its action: (i) proactive engagement with public stakeholders to support attractive investment frameworks, (ii) development of financial performance benchmarks, and (iii) definition and sharing of best practices in relation to Environmental, Social and Governance issues.
relevant_communication:
- Second Edition of the LTIIA ESG Handbook which aims to provide a concise and simple overview of the various frameworks, tools and standards that infrastructure investors are using today to invest responsibly.  
- Library of Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) indicators for infrastructure investments in partnership with eFront. Over 300 indicators were included in 
the first release of the Library (October 
2016) and expansion continues. 
- Consultation with EIOPA regarding the treatment of infrastructure under Solvency II 
- Development of long-term infrastructure benchmark, in cooperation with EDHEC Infrastructure Institute (supporting the academic ressearch since 2012, in June 2017 EDHECinfra released 384 infrastructure debt and equity indices).  
- Annual meetings and other LTIIA own events bringing together prominent infrastructure investment executives, key policy makers and renowned academics to discuss current issues and trends in deploying private money to public infrastructure (namely LTIIA Private Infrastructure Forum). LTIIA has also a strong pipeline of third party events.  
- Climate Task Force, which helps several government with the investment component of INDCs 
- LTIIA partnered with E3PO and FIEC for organizing a PPP-centred seminar in Brussels in April’17. 
- LTIIA joined the B20 Taskforce for Financing Growth and Infrastructure
